<small>Also see: **<big>[[H7952|שָׁלָה]]</big>**</small>

 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁלָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁלֵו‎</span>] **verb** ==be quiet, at ease== ([[Eccl.47.13|Eccl 47:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שלוה‎</span> ***prosperity***, [[Eccl.41.1|Eccl 41:1]] c <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שליו‎</span> ***prosperous, at ease***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be tranquil, quiet, ceaee***; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁלָא‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁלי‎</span> ***be at ease***, then ***be careless, thoughtless, go astray*** [for Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁגָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁגַג‎</span>] Aph\`el ***neglect*** (God, etc.), Biblical Aramaic [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁלוּ‎</span> ***error***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (<img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">) ***be. forgetful, neglectful, content, free*** (from anxiety)); — 

**Qal 1.** ***be***, (have) ***quiet: Perfect*** 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁלַיְתִּי‎</span> [[Job.3.26|Job 3:26]]. 

**2.** ***be at ease, prosper***, of wicked, 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁלוּ‎</span> [[Jer.12.1|Jer 12:1]]; [[Lam.1.5|Lam 1:5]], also ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשְׁלָ֫יוּ‎</span> ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:75u»§ 75u</sup>) [[Job.12.5|Job 12:5]], and (of good) [[Ps.122.6|Ps 122:6]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֵ֫שֶׁל‎</span> [[Job.27.8|Job 27:8]] see II.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁלח‎</span>). **Niph\`al** ***Imperfect*** 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּשָּׁלוּ‎</span> jussive [[2Chr.29.11|2Chr 29:11]] ***be*** not ***negligent*** (easy-going; German 'bequem'). **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּשְׁלֶה‎</span> jussive [[2Kgs.4.28|2Kgs 4:28]] ***do*** not ***mislead*** me (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּכַזֵּב‎</span> v[[2Kgs.4.16|2Kgs 4:16]]), strong Aramaism, whence [[BDB#Klo|Klo]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּשְׁגֶּה‎</span>.
